intro: Nietoa, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, South America, and parts of Asia. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves that often have a silvery or grayish underside. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine and ornamental horticulture.
